Package se.arkalix.net.http

Interface HttpConnection

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    HttpClientConnection, HttpConnectionWithArSystem, HttpConsumerConnection, HttpServiceConnection
    public interface HttpConnection
    A connection established with a remote peer, allowing for messages to either be sent to or received from that peer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Future<?> close()
      Attempts to close the connection.
      boolean isLive()  
      boolean isSecure()  
      java.security.cert.Certificate[] localCertificateChain()  
      java.net.InetSocketAddress localSocketAddress()  
      java.security.cert.Certificate[] remoteCertificateChain()  
      java.net.InetSocketAddress remoteSocketAddress()  

    • Method Detail

      • remoteCertificateChain

        java.security.cert.Certificate[] remoteCertificateChain()
        Returns:
        Certificate chain associated with host reachable via this connection.
        Throws:
        SecurityDisabled - If this connection is not secure.

      • remoteSocketAddress

        java.net.InetSocketAddress remoteSocketAddress()
        Returns:
        Address of host reachable via this connection.

      • localCertificateChain

        java.security.cert.Certificate[] localCertificateChain()
        Returns:
        Certificate chain used by this host to establish this connection.
        Throws:
        SecurityDisabled - If this connection is not secure.

      • localSocketAddress

        java.net.InetSocketAddress localSocketAddress()
        Returns:
        Local network interface bound to this connection.

      • isLive

        boolean isLive()
        Returns:
        true only if this connection can be used to send requests to its remote peer.

      • isSecure

        boolean isSecure()
        Returns:
        true only if this is an HTTPS connection.

      • close

        Future<?> close()
        Attempts to close the connection.
        Returns:
        Future completed when closing is done. Can be safely ignored.
